sources.title: The Great Dan Patch
sources.description: Title: The Great Dan Patch Summary: Story of the legendary trotting horse Dan Patch. Directed by: Joseph M. Newman Actors: Production Company: W.R. Frank Productions Release Date: 22 July 1949 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 David Palmer, a young chemist, returns to his father's Indiana farm, to marry a local school teacher, Ruth Treadwell. David meets again his father's horse-trainer, Ben Lathrop, whose daughter, Cissy, has left high school to help her father. Palmer marries and becomes wealthy through an invention, and is able to indulge his socially-ambitious wife. His father dies and Palmer returns to Indiana, where his interest in harness-racing is rekindled, as is his interest in Cissy Lathrop.

sources.title: The Great Dan Patch
sources.description: You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page .

sources.title: The Great Dan Patch (1949) BIOGRAPHY
sources.description:
Stars: Dennis O'Keefe, Gail Russell, Ruth Warrick
Director: Joseph M. Newman

After the death of his father, a horse trainer, scientist David Palmer devotes himself to Dan Patch, a harness-racing horse. When the horse's driver takes ill, David drives Dan to a record time at a Kentucky track.

metadata.Plot: David Palmer, a young chemist, returns to his father's Indiana farm, to marry a local school teacher, Ruth Treadwell. David meets again his father's horse-trainer, Ben Lathrop, whose daughter, Cissy, has left high school to help her father. Palmer marries and becomes wealthy through an invention, and is able to indulge his socially-ambitious wife. His father dies and Palmer returns to Indiana, where his interest in harness-racing is rekindled, as is his interest in Cissy Lathrop.
